newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi Aramco cuts bunker fuel prices.
newsitem.headline: Saudi Aramco cuts bunker fuel prices.

text.p: Saudi Aramco has cut A-960 bunker fuel prices from Ras Tanura and Dammam by $1.50 to $103.50 a tonne ($15.89 a barrel) with effect May 29, the company said on Wednesday.
A-960 bunker fuel oil from the Red Sea ports of Jeddah and Yanbu went down by $1.50 to $98.50 a tonne ($15.12 a barrel).
A-888 bunker diesel from the two Gulf ports is $2 lower at $210 a tonne and $2 lower from the Red Sea at $196.50 a tonne.
